title: Getting started
text: launch app Shiny App-Packages book, can simply supply name branch: Let’s start one branches early chapters (quite app-package yet):  launch_app() automatically download application files folder current working directory: branch storing app-package, launch_app() loads package launches application:

title: Getting started
text: check_r_pkg() function useful determining directory contains R package: verbose set TRUE, details provided checked:
code: check_r_pkg("03_proj-app") #> [1] FALSE check_r_pkg("11b_inst-bslib", verbose = TRUE) #> ℹ Checking DESCRIPTION for package fields #> ✔ Package, Version, License, Description, Title, Author, and Maintainer found! #> ℹ Checking .Rroj for project build fields #> ✔ BuildType, PackageUseDevtools, and PackageInstallArgs in .Rproj! #> ✔ '11b_inst-bslib/' is an R package #> [1] TRUE

text: get_app() function download open specified branch new Posit Workbench session.

what: Check DESCRIPTION File for Required Fields — check_desc_file
title: Check DESCRIPTION File for Required Fields — check_desc_file
text: function ensures DESCRIPTION file contains necessary fields R package. operates verbosely default, providing alerts checking process.

title: Check DESCRIPTION File for Required Fields — check_desc_file
Check DESCRIPTION File for Required Fields — check_desc_file
text: file character string specifying path DESCRIPTION file. verbose logical parameter; set TRUE, detailed messages displayed check.

title: Check DESCRIPTION File for Required Fields — check_desc_file
text: logical value; TRUE required fields present, FALSE otherwise.

what: Check Directory for R Package Structure — check_r_pkg
title: Check Directory for R Package Structure — check_r_pkg
text: function checks directory ascertain required files (.Rproj DESCRIPTION) configured correctly R package. provides verbose output detailing checks passed failed.

title: Check Directory for R Package Structure — check_r_pkg
Check Directory for R Package Structure — check_r_pkg
text: path character string specifying path directory checked. verbose logical parameter; set TRUE, detailed messages displayed check.

title: Check Directory for R Package Structure — check_r_pkg
text: logical value; TRUE .Rproj DESCRIPTION files configured correctly, FALSE otherwise.

title: Check Directory for R Package Structure — check_r_pkg
text: function wraps around check_desc_file check_rproj_file functions check DESCRIPTION .Rproj files. verbose TRUE, use cli package functions alert user checks performed results.

what: Clone a Specific Branch of the moviesApp Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
title: Clone a Specific Branch of the moviesApp Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
text: Clones specified branch 'moviesApp' GitHub repository current working directory. cleans cloned directory removing .git files, .DS_Store, .Rbuildignore files, renames R project file, optionally opens new RStudio session.

title: Clone a Specific Branch of the moviesApp Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
Clone a Specific Branch of the moviesApp Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
text: app name branch cloned character string. specified, defaults "main". open logical parameter, set TRUE, function attempt open new R project new RStudio session using rstudioapi::openProject. Defaults FALSE.

title: Clone a Specific Branch of the moviesApp Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
text: Invisible NULL. function called side effects.

title: Clone a Specific Branch of the moviesApp Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
text: directory branch already exists, deleted re-cloned ensure latest version present. cloning, function performs cleanup operations: Deletes .git directory files. Removes .DS_Store files. Deletes .Rbuildignore files present. renames R project file match name cloned branch , specified, opens project RStudio.

title: Clone a Specific Branch of the moviesApp Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
text: rstudioapi::openProject function requires RStudio installed work R running inside RStudio. working directory temporarily changed function's execution reset end.

what: List Branches of the moviesApp Repository — list_apps
title: List Branches of the moviesApp Repository — list_apps
text: function clones 'moviesApp' GitHub repository, extracts list branches along last update time, returns information tibble. repository cloned temporary directory, removed function executes.

title: List Branches of the moviesApp Repository — list_apps
List Branches of the moviesApp Repository — list_apps
text: regex optional character string containing regular expression (regex) filter branch names

title: List Branches of the moviesApp Repository — list_apps
text: tibble three columns: 'source', 'branch_name', 'updated', listing source branch, branch name, last updated date.

title: List Branches of the moviesApp Repository — list_apps
text: function operates several steps: saves current working directory revert back later clones 'moviesApp' repository GitHub temporary directory lists branches cloned repository separates branch names source branch_name cleans deleting temporary directory restoring original working directory Note function currently use regex parameter filter branches. parameter can implemented future versions allow branch filtering based regular expressions.

title: List Branches of the moviesApp Repository — list_apps
code: list_apps() #> # A tibble: 36 × 3 #>    source branch_name        updated             #>    <chr>  <chr>              <dttm>              #>  1 NA     main               2023-10-25 15:12:48 #>  2 origin 02_movies-app      2023-11-19 22:23:38 #>  3 origin 03_proj-app        2023-11-17 22:50:17 #>  4 origin 04_description     2023-11-02 20:35:02 #>  5 origin 05_rproj           2023-11-02 20:35:17 #>  6 origin 06a_create-package 2023-11-02 20:35:34 #>  7 origin 06b_devtools       2023-11-02 20:35:52 #>  8 origin 07_roxygen2        2023-11-17 22:53:36 #>  9 origin 08a_pkg-exports    2023-11-17 22:54:17 #> 10 origin 08b_pkg-imports    2023-11-17 22:54:52 #> # ℹ 26 more rows list_apps(regex = "tests") #> [1] "12a_tests-specs"     "12b_tests-fixtures"  "12c_tests-helpers"   #> [4] "12d_tests-modules"   "12e_tests-system"    "12f_tests-mocks"     #> [7] "12g_tests-snapshots"
